comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
I analyzed using `NewGuid` by @daxian-dbw [method ](https://gist.github.com/daxian-dbw/07847ff5ef6da2c100e8b22bd94f0feb)
Found **133** *.ps1 scripts on GitHub (I did not search *.psm1).
Thus it is very rarely used cmdlet.

I manually inspected these scripts.
I did not find that this cmdlet was used in loops.
I did not find using `Empty` guids.

A common usage (in descending order of popularity):
```powershell
$GUID = (New-Guid).Guid

[string]$Name = (New-Guid).ToString()

$id = New-Guid
$name = "Solution_$id"

$wpconfig = $wpconfig.Replace("eisauthkey",$(New-Guid))

function New-Guid {
    [System.Guid]::NewGuid().ToString("d").Substring(0, 4).Replace("-", "")
}

$guid = (New-Guid).GUID.Replace("-","_")
```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @PowerShell/powershell-committee we discussed this and for discovery reasons as well as shipping this previously, we should have new-guid even though it's a simple operation for users familiar with the guid class
